body:
Comment 2 by **Tom.Maiaroto**: 
I assume you can implement it yourself, no? Given it's more of a pattern if anything.
I've been using it in PHP for years. You can read more here:
http://code.tutsplus.com/tutorials/aspect-oriented-programming-in-php--net-24974 ... and
I use it with the Lithium framework. I'm trying to see if there are any packages that
help out with it myself, stumbled upon this (and some other questions)...and kept
scratching my head. Why isn't anyone using AOP in Go?

My interests are in the organization and separation of concerns more than any
performance considerations though. Perhaps it's just not a super popular thing to do.
